cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang.org/x/net/html. This flaw allows an attacker to craft input to the parse functions that would be processed non-linearly with respect to its length, resulting in extremely slow parsing. This issue can cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang.org/x/net/html: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is rated as an Important severity because an attacker can craft malicious input that causes the parsing functions to process data non-linearly, resulting in significant delays which leads to a denial of service by exhausting system resources.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: It is recommended that existing users of Red Hat OpenShift Builds 1.0 to 1.1.

vulnerabilities.title: golang.org/x/net/html: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')

notes.text: An argument injection vulnerability was found in go-git. This flaw allows an attacker to set arbitrary values to git-upload-pack flags, leading to command or code execution, exposure of sensitive data, or other unintended behavior. This is only possible in configurations where the file transport protocol is being used.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go-git: argument injection via the URL field
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: It is recommended that existing users of Red Hat OpenShift Builds 1.0 to 1.1.
In cases where it is not possible to update to the latest version of go-git, it is recommended to enforce validation rules for values passed in the URL field.

vulnerabilities.title: go-git: argument injection via the URL field
